page.title: 16AUCHTERMUCHTY (POLITICS)
page.content: An excerpt from the{Fife Herald}(the local weekly newspaper{June 7, 1985.} POLITICS & HOME COMPUTERS The chairman of A'Muchty and District branch of the N.E. Fife cnservative Assoc. is to visit the Commodore computer show in London.Having successfully used his own commodore both in the local and European elections, he and his branch are convinced that the use of new information technolgy for improved contact with electors is just one of the benefits to be gained. Speaking in 'muchty the chairman said: "The Coservatives always been the party best able to respond to changes in society and to the needs of the people.I believe that using computers in a local way,responds to local desire for information about current events.
